data.text: @VeryModernMegha Fair enough. But they don’t always get it wrong and I personally don’t think that this is an outlandish claim.
@VeryModernMegha I take it you’re not British?
@VeryModernMegha What is wrong with believing that Meghan may possibly be missing her online friends? It’s quite plausible.
@MeghanMaven You really shouldn’t re-tweet things that you cannot confirm!
@Kelli_Fields Aww that’s lovely! As toxic as it can be at times (LOL) I’m grateful for social media as I’ve met some wonderful people who will be friends for life. Love you too, Kelli. ♥️

@Kelli_Fields It depends on your circumstances I guess. For you personally it may not be important, but for some it is - I have social media to stay connected to my family and friends back home and friends overseas. Agree to disagree :)

@Kelli_Fields There is more to life than work, whether it be humanitarian or not. She’s still a person who deserves to have personal relationships and connections with other human beings outside of official duties. I’m not offended at all, I just disagree.

@Kelli_Fields Nobody is saying her focus isn’t on Harry and her new role... just that she’s missing her friends. She’s far away from home too, social media is how we stay connected these days and she hasn’t got that.
@venachia I agree. There’s been enough scandal in the BRF, I don’t see how a carefully curated and monitored social media account would cause problems.
@venachia Princess Madeleine just made an Instagram account too. You choose what you share, she should have been allowed to just erase old content and start fresh in keeping with her new status.
@Kelli_Fields She loved social media, she loved having her blog and was very active. It wouldn’t be surprising at all if she’s feeling isolated and cut off.
